text: this is one of the entrances to the
al-aqsa mosque where typically on a
Friday there are large numbers of
Palestinians going through to pray but
because of the recent attacks there have
been including a stabbing just a week
ago stabbings that have taken place
across Israel and the occupied West Bank
well there's an increased police
presence today and there are
restrictions have been placed in who can
go in only men aged over 45 and women
are being allowed we've seen new metal
detectors being used on streets not far
away from here now
it is as is often the case the tensions
around this holy site that have really
contributed to the recent upsurge in
violence this is a place that is sacred
to both Muslims we call it the noble
sanctuary and to Jews who call it Temple
Mount now the Israeli officials are
blaming the Palestinian leadership for
exploiting the tensions here to incite
violence Palestinian authorities say
that it's Israeli policies that are
really to blame it's been 18 months now
since the last round of peace talks
collapsed and that's also contributing
to feelings of hopelessness you have
ordinary Israelis and ordinary
Palestinians who were very worried that
these sporadic attacks could now
escalate and that they could spiral out
of control
